intro: Cephaelis hexamera, commonly known as the six-petaled celandine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
